	- [Metaverseconf_Busan1.txt](../assets/Metaverseconf_Busan1_1713949788418_0.txt) Jess's presentation snapshot [Metaverseconf_Busan1 - Google Slides](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1AVstOhBoV4El6v42VG3bSeZAwy6XgU1KRl0M7A1FvIc/edit#slide=id.g2bfac131e9c_0_14)
	- [FinalDraftMetaverseOntology_240425 - Google Sheets](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/13k7lC4BZbxF9EXrWN0nJSqfLUjMw_qD3sIns_pqR-m0/edit#gid=2098276378)
	- Examples of Jess's style
		- [Full article: Strategies for connecting low income communities to the creative economy through play: two case studies in Northern England (tandfonline.com)](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/17510694.2018.1453770)
		- [Untangling creativity and art for policy purposes: ethnographic insights on Manchester International Festival and Manchester Day Parade (tandfonline.com)](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/epdf/10.1080/10286632.2016.1150268?needAccess=true)
	- [GPT for the task](https://chat.openai.com/g/g-YVv3VjlrR)
		- ```text
		  We are writing a paper in two parts. The first part is based on metaverseconf_busan1.txt which you have in your file store. I am not going to write that section, it's by my co-author. You should however use it as context for the second section, which is our to write. 
		  ChatGPT
		  The document "Ordinary Ontologies: Strategies for Standardising Metaverse Processes, Systems, and Technologies" by Dr. Jessica Symons and Dr. John O'Hare discusses approaches to clarify metaverse environments to overcome adoption barriers. It details efforts in synchronizing terminologies across sectors to standardize definitions and enhance interoperability. The paper also elaborates on the creation of metaverse ontologies through AI tools, consultation, and collaboration with various stakeholders, aiming to develop a shared understanding and support the integration of diverse metaverse applications. It reflects on both technological and societal dimensions, emphasizing the need for comprehensive, inclusive frameworks that align with real-world applications and user experiences.
		  
		  With this context, how can I assist you in crafting the second part of your paper?
		  
		  User
		  I have given you instructions about the tone and voice and style to use, can you check and read some of that back to me?
		  ChatGPT
		  Sure, here's a recap of the instructions for the tone and style of the paper you're writing:
		  
		  Formal and Scholarly: The paper should maintain a high level of formality and precision, using a voice that is authoritative and analytical.
		  Persuasive and Insightful: It's crafted to not only inform but also convince the reader of the discussed concepts' viability.
		  Reflective and Critical: The paper should engage deeply with the subject matter, offering critical assessments backed by data and theoretical analysis.
		  Complex Syntax and Structured Flow: The writing should utilize complex sentence structures and a logical narrative flow.
		  Specialized and Technical Vocabulary: The vocabulary should be rich and specialized, appropriate for an academic audience.
		  Integrative Narrative Elements: Descriptive language may be used to illustrate points vividly.
		  Directive and Inclusive Language: The style combines directive statements with an inclusive tone, highlighting collective endeavors.
		  Data-Driven and Example-Rich: Arguments should be supported by relevant data and examples.
		  Empathetic Engagement: The paper should show awareness of different perspectives, especially in discussions of social issues.
		  Solution-Oriented and Practical: Focus on proposing and evaluating practical solutions.
		  Does this align with what you have in mind for the style and tone of your paper?
		  
		  User
		  yes, also we should write in highly compliant latex. Where a citation looks like it should be made you can suggest something using the internet or just use \cite{anon} to show that I need to investigate the assertion further. Modify your overall instructions to reflect all these changesOverall Tone:
		  Formal and Scholarly: Maintains a high level of formality and precision, suitable for academic and policy-oriented publications. The voice is consistently authoritative, employing an analytical approach that leans on robust data, theoretical frameworks, and extensive citation of relevant literature.
		  Persuasive and Insightful: Crafted to not only inform but also convince the reader of the viability and necessity of the discussed concepts or technologies. It strategically presents arguments, balancing between current practices and visionary goals.
		  Reflective and Critical: Engages deeply with the subject matter, reflecting on existing conditions and offering critical assessments that are backed by empirical data and theoretical analysis.
		  Linguistic Features:
		  Complex Syntax and Structured Flow: Utilizes complex sentence structures with a preference for passive constructions where appropriate, ensuring the focus remains on the information conveyed rather than the author's personal perspective. The narrative flow is logical and methodical, with a clear progression from introduction through to conclusion, facilitating an argumentative build-up.
		  Specialized and Technical Vocabulary: Employs a rich lexicon that includes specialized terms from fields such as digital technology, cultural policy, ethnography, and socio-economic studies. This not only enhances precision but also aligns with the expectations of an informed academic audience.
		  Integrative Narrative Elements: Occasionally incorporates narrative elements to illustrate points more vividly, using descriptive language to bring abstract concepts to life and make the material more accessible and engaging.
		  Directive and Inclusive Language: Combines directive statements with an inclusive tone that acknowledges collaboration and community involvement. This style supports the presentation of research or projects as collective endeavors and underscores the importance of stakeholder and community engagement.
		  Argumentation and Presentation:
		  Data-Driven and Example-Rich: Supports arguments with data, case studies, and examples that are relevant and thoughtfully selected. This approach not only strengthens the credibility of the arguments but also makes the theoretical discussions tangible.
		  Empathetic Engagement: Shows a strong awareness of different perspectives, especially when discussing social issues or community impacts. It involves an empathetic undertone that seeks to respect and understand varied experiences and viewpoints.
		  Solution-Oriented and Practical: While it critically analyzes problems, it also focuses on proposing and evaluating practical solutions, emphasizing applications that could lead to real-world improvements.
		  ```
		- ```text
		  \section{Integrating and Expanding Metaverse Ontologies through Advanced AI Models: A Study of the Agentic Mycelia Framework}
		  The metaverse, a term coined by science fiction writer Neal Stephenson in his 1992 novel "Snow Crash," has captured the imagination of technologists, entrepreneurs, and the general public alike. It represents a vision of a shared, immersive, and persistent virtual space where users can interact, create, and engage in a wide range of activities \cite{stephenson1992snow}. As the concept of the metaverse continues to evolve and gain traction, the development of formal ontologies becomes increasingly crucial for structuring and understanding these complex digital environments.
		  This paper presents a two-phase experimental approach that explores the potential of advanced artificial intelligence (AI) models in scaffolding the creation and expansion of metaverse ontologies. The culmination of this research is the conceptualisation of the "Agentic Mycelia" framework, which addresses critical challenges such as interoperability, user empowerment, and adaptable governance. By leveraging the capabilities of large language models (LLMs) and incorporating principles from various domains, including cryptography, decentralised systems, and user-centric design, the Agentic Mycelia framework paves the way for a more interconnected, secure, and user-empowering future for the metaverse.
		  \subsection{Phase One: Initial Exploration and Ontology Development}
		  The first phase of our research involved a collaborative exploration with several state-of-the-art LLMs: Claude, Google Gemini Advance 1.5, and ChatGPT 4. These AI systems, known for their impressive knowledge bases and generative capabilities, were selected to assist in the construction of an initial metaverse ontology \cite{brown2020language, chen2021evaluating}.
		  Over a period of two days, we engaged in iterative interactions with the LLMs, posing questions, seeking clarifications, and refining the ontology based on their responses. This approach allowed us to leverage the vast knowledge and reasoning capabilities of the AI systems, ensuring the consistency, completeness, and coherence of the resulting ontology.
		  The Web Ontology Language (OWL), a widely-used standard for creating ontologies in the Semantic Web, was chosen as the initial framework for representing the metaverse ontology \cite{owl}. OWL's expressiveness and ability to capture complex relationships and hierarchies made it well-suited for modeling the multifaceted nature of the metaverse.
		  The resulting ontology encompassed a wide range of concepts and relationships, including:
		  \begin{itemize}
		  \item Agents: Representing both human users and AI entities, along with their attributes, skills, and relationships within the metaverse. This allows for the modeling of complex social interactions and collaborations between various types of agents \cite{norouzi2021modeling}.
		  \item Scenes and Objects: Describing the virtual environments, their characteristics, and the interactive elements that populate them. This enables the representation of rich and immersive experiences within the metaverse \cite{sra2016metaspace}.
		  \item Digital Assets and Economy: Addressing the creation, ownership, and exchange of virtual goods and currencies within the metaverse economy. This is crucial for enabling meaningful economic activities and value creation within virtual worlds \cite{lopez2020virtual}.
		  \item Events and Interactions: Encompassing social gatherings, communication, and collaborative activities that occur within metaverse spaces. This allows for the modeling of dynamic and emergent behaviors within the metaverse \cite{dionisio20133d}.
		  \item Governance and Policies: Defining the decision-making processes, rules, and regulations that govern interactions and behavior within the metaverse. This is essential for establishing trust, ensuring fairness, and promoting positive user experiences \cite{gadekallu2022blockchain}.
		  \item Infrastructure and Technology: Representing the hardware, software, and networking components that enable the metaverse experience. This includes considerations for scalability, performance, and accessibility \cite{nguyen2021metaverse}.
		  \end{itemize}
		  To enhance the accessibility and practical application of the ontology, we subsequently converted it from OWL to Linked JSON format \cite{linked-json}. This transition offered a more user-friendly and developer-oriented representation while preserving the core semantic relationships. Linked JSON's simplicity and focus on linking data using @id made it an attractive choice for representing the metaverse ontology in a more manageable and accessible manner.
		  \subsection{Phase Two: Refinement and Expansion - The Agentic Mycelia Emerges}
		  Building upon the foundation laid in the first phase, the second phase of our research focused on refining and expanding the ontology into a more comprehensive framework called the "Agentic Mycelia." This framework envisions a decentralised and AI-driven ecosystem of interconnected metaverse instances, each with its own unique characteristics and governance structures, yet able to communicate and interact seamlessly with others.
		  The Agentic Mycelia framework draws inspiration from the concept of mycelium, the vegetative part of a fungus consisting of a network of fine white filaments \cite{stamets2005mycelium}. Just as mycelium forms intricate and interconnected networks in nature, the Agentic Mycelia framework aims to create a robust and adaptive network of metaverse instances that can evolve and grow organically.
		  \subsubsection{Key Principles of the Agentic Mycelia}
		  The Agentic Mycelia framework is built upon three key principles: interoperability, user empowerment, and adaptable governance.
		  Interoperability is achieved through the use of standardised protocols, ontologies, and translation mechanisms that enable seamless communication, asset transfer, and value exchange between different metaverse instances \cite{interoperability}. By establishing a common language and set of rules, the Agentic Mycelia framework ensures that users can navigate and interact across various virtual worlds without friction.
		  User empowerment is a central tenet of the Agentic Mycelia framework, which seeks to provide users with greater control over their data, identity, and experiences within the metaverse \cite{user-empowerment}. This is achieved through the implementation of self-sovereign identity solutions, privacy-preserving technologies, and user-centric governance models. By putting users at the center of the metaverse ecosystem, the Agentic Mycelia framework aims to foster trust, autonomy, and meaningful engagement.
		  Adaptable governance is another key principle of the Agentic Mycelia framework, which recognises the need for flexibility and responsiveness in the face of evolving user needs and technological advancements \cite{adaptable-governance}. The framework allows individual metaverse instances to establish their own rules and regulations while remaining compatible with the broader Mycelia network. This is achieved through the use of AI-driven governance models that can adapt to changing circumstances and user preferences, ensuring that the metaverse remains a dynamic and inclusive space.
		  \subsubsection{Technological Underpinnings}
		  The Agentic Mycelia framework leverages a unified public key infrastructure (PKI) architecture based on well-established cryptographic principles such as BIP39 and BIP32 \cite{bip39, bip32}. This ensures secure and verifiable identity management and ownership proof within the metaverse, further reinforcing user empowerment and data privacy.
		  The use of decentralised technologies, such as blockchain and distributed ledgers, plays a crucial role in the Agentic Mycelia framework \cite{swan2015blockchain}. These technologies enable the creation of tamper-proof records, transparent transactions, and secure value exchange within the metaverse ecosystem. By leveraging the power of decentralisation, the Agentic Mycelia framework aims to create a more resilient, trustworthy, and user-controlled metaverse experience.
		  \subsubsection{Expanding the Ontology}
		  To seamlessly integrate with the Agentic Mycelia framework, the Linked JSON ontology developed in the first phase was further expanded and refined. This involved the addition of new entities and relationships that capture the various components and interactions within the interconnected metaverse ecosystem.
		  Some of the key additions to the ontology include:
		  \begin{itemize}
		  \item Identity and Authentication: Entities and relationships related to user identity, authentication, and authorisation, leveraging the PKI architecture and self-sovereign identity principles.
		  \item Asset Ownership and Transfer: Representations of digital asset ownership, provenance, and transfer mechanisms, enabling secure and verifiable transactions within the metaverse economy.
		  \item Governance Models: Ontological structures for representing various governance models, including decentralised autonomous organisations (DAOs), reputation systems, and AI-driven decision-making processes.
		  \item Interoperability Protocols: Entities and relationships that define standardised communication protocols, data formats, and translation mechanisms for enabling seamless interaction between metaverse instances.
		  \item Privacy and Security: Representations of privacy-preserving technologies, encryption schemes, and access control mechanisms to ensure the protection of user data and interactions within the metaverse.
		  \end{itemize}
		  These expansions to the ontology aim to capture the rich and complex dynamics of the Agentic Mycelia framework, providing a comprehensive and flexible foundation for modeling and understanding the interconnected metaverse ecosystem.
		  \subsubsection{Visualising the Framework}
		  To enhance the understanding and facilitate further discussion of the Agentic Mycelia framework, we employed a "Diagrams as Code" approach using the Mermaid syntax \cite{mermaid}. This allowed us to create clear and intuitive visual representations of the ontology and its interactions within the broader Agentic Mycelia network.
		  The visualisations encompass various aspects of the framework, including:
		  \begin{itemize}
		  \item Class hierarchies and relationships: Depicting the core entities and their relationships within the metaverse ontology, such as agents, scenes, digital assets, and governance structures.
		  \item User journeys and interactions: Illustrating the flow of user experiences, interactions, and transactions across different metaverse instances, highlighting the seamless navigation and interoperability enabled by the Agentic Mycelia framework.
		  \item Governance and decision-making processes: Visualising the AI-driven governance models, reputation systems, and decentralised decision-making mechanisms that underpin the adaptable and user-centric nature of the Agentic Mycelia framework.
		  \item Technical architectures and protocols: Representing the underlying technical components, such as the PKI architecture, decentralised technologies, and interoperability protocols, that form the foundation of the Agentic Mycelia framework.
		  \end{itemize}
		  These visualisations serve as powerful communication tools, enabling researchers, developers, and stakeholders to grasp the complex relationships and dynamics of the evolving metaverse ecosystem. By providing a clear and accessible representation of the Agentic Mycelia framework, these diagrams facilitate collaboration, ideation, and implementation efforts.
		  \subsection{Implications and Future Directions}
		  The development of the Agentic Mycelia framework, combined with the refined metaverse ontology, offers a promising vision for the future of digital interaction and virtual worlds. By addressing key challenges such as interoperability, user empowerment, and adaptable governance, this framework lays the groundwork for a more user-centric and interconnected metaverse experience.
		  The potential implications of the Agentic Mycelia framework are far-reaching and transformative. For human users, it presents a range of benefits and opportunities:
		  \begin{itemize}
		  \item Seamless Navigation: Users can effortlessly traverse different metaverse instances while maintaining their identity, preferences, and digital assets. This creates a cohesive and unified experience, eliminating the barriers and fragmentation that currently exist in the virtual world landscape.
		  \item Enhanced Privacy and Security: The integration of self-sovereign identity solutions and privacy-preserving technologies empowers users with greater control over their personal data and online experiences. This fosters trust and encourages more meaningful and authentic interactions within the metaverse.
		  \item Economic Opportunities: The interconnected nature of the Agentic Mycelia framework enables the creation of a vibrant and thriving virtual economy. Users can engage in secure and verifiable transactions, participate in value creation activities, and explore new avenues for entrepreneurship and innovation within the metaverse.
		  \item Community Governance: The AI-driven governance models and decentralised decision-making processes embedded in the Agentic Mycelia framework promote user participation and empowerment. Users have a direct say in shaping the rules, policies, and evolution of their virtual communities, fostering a sense of ownership and belonging.
		  \item Safe and Secure Environment: The Agentic Mycelia framework prioritises the safety and well-being of users through the implementation of robust safeguarding measures and collaboration with legal authorities. This ensures that the metaverse remains a secure and protected space, where users can interact and explore without fear of harassment, exploitation, or harm.
		  \end{itemize}
		  Beyond the benefits for individual users, the Agentic Mycelia framework has the potential to revolutionise various industries and domains. From education and training to entertainment and social interaction, the metaverse presents countless opportunities for innovation, growth, and transformation \cite{lee2021all}.
		  Furthermore, the Agentic Mycelia framework opens up new avenues for research and development in fields such as AI, decentralised systems, and human-computer interaction. The integration of advanced AI models and decentralised technologies within the metaverse ecosystem presents exciting challenges and possibilities for pushing the boundaries of what is possible in virtual worlds.
		  However, it is important to acknowledge the limitations and potential risks associated with the Agentic Mycelia framework. As with any complex and rapidly evolving technology, there are concerns around privacy, security, and the potential for misuse or exploitation \cite{falchuk2018social}. It is crucial to address these challenges through ongoing research, collaboration, and the development of robust governance frameworks and ethical guidelines.
		  Future research directions in this area may include:
		  \begin{itemize}
		  \item Refinement and validation of the metaverse ontology through real-world applications and case studies.
		  \item Development of standardised protocols and APIs for seamless interoperability between metaverse instances.
		  \item Exploration of advanced AI techniques, such as reinforcement learning and multi-agent systems, for enabling more sophisticated and adaptive governance models within the Agentic Mycelia framework.
		  \item Investigation of the social, psychological, and cultural implications of the metaverse, and the development of strategies for fostering positive and inclusive virtual communities.
		  \item Collaboration with legal experts and policymakers to establish robust legal frameworks and regulations for the metaverse, addressing issues such as intellectual property rights, data privacy, and online safety.
		  \end{itemize}
		  By pursuing these research directions and engaging in interdisciplinary collaboration, we can work towards realising the full potential of the Agentic Mycelia framework and the metaverse as a whole. The journey ahead is filled with exciting possibilities and challenges, and it is through ongoing exploration, experimentation, and dialogue that we can shape the future of this transformative technology.
		  \subsection{Conclusion}
		  The Agentic Mycelia framework, born from the collaborative efforts of human researchers and advanced AI models, represents a significant step forward in the development of formal ontologies for the metaverse. By leveraging the power of large language models and incorporating principles from various domains, this framework offers a comprehensive and adaptable approach to structuring and understanding the complex digital ecosystems that make up the metaverse.
		  The key principles of interoperability, user empowerment, and adaptable governance, along with the technological underpinnings of decentralised systems and cryptographic techniques, form the foundation of the Agentic Mycelia framework. This framework not only addresses the technical challenges of creating a seamless and interconnected metaverse but also places the needs and rights of users at the forefront.
		  As we continue to explore and refine the Agentic Mycelia framework, it is essential to engage in ongoing dialogue and collaboration with researchers, developers, policymakers, and users. By working together and leveraging the collective intelligence of both humans and machines, we can unlock the full potential of the metaverse as a space for innovation, creativity, and social connection.
		  The metaverse represents a new frontier in human-computer interaction and digital society, and the development of formal ontologies like the Agentic Mycelia framework is crucial for navigating this uncharted territory. As we embark on this exciting journey, let us remain committed to the principles of user empowerment, inclusivity, and ethical responsibility, ensuring that the metaverse becomes a force for good in our increasingly digital world.
		  \bibliographystyle{unsrt}
		  \bibliography{references}
		  ```
	-

## Current Landscape (2025)

- Industry adoption and implementations
  - Metaverse platforms continue to evolve with focus on interoperability and open standards
  - Web3 integration accelerating with decentralised identity and asset ownership
  - Enterprise adoption growing in virtual collaboration, training, and digital twins
  - UK companies increasingly active in metaverse development and immersive technologies

- Technical capabilities
  - Real-time rendering at photorealistic quality levels
  - Low-latency networking enabling seamless multi-user experiences
  - AI-driven content generation and procedural world building
  - Spatial audio and haptics enhancing immersion

- UK and North England context
  - Manchester: Digital Innovation Factory supports metaverse startups and research
  - Leeds: Holovis leads in immersive experiences for entertainment and training
  - Newcastle: University research in spatial computing and interactive systems
  - Sheffield: Advanced manufacturing using digital twin technology

- Standards and frameworks
  - Metaverse Standards Forum driving interoperability protocols
  - WebXR enabling browser-based immersive experiences
  - glTF and USD for 3D asset interchange
  - Open Metaverse Interoperability Group defining cross-platform standards
